Write a data file from R

Source: R/upload.R
write_data.Rd

  • Use write_data() to create a new file in a workspace.

  • Use write_data_version() to write a data file as a new version of an existing document.

Usage

write_data(
  x,
  uuid,
  file_name,
  file_type,
  ...,
  description = NULL,
  parent_uuid = NULL,
  use_proxy = FALSE
)

write_data_version(x, uuid, ..., use_proxy = FALSE)

Arguments

x

R object to write to file.

uuid

Either a workspace UUID to create a new document or an asset UUID to create a new version of an existing document.

file_name

Name to give file.

file_type

Either "csv", "rds", "xlsx", or "parquet".

...

Additional arguments to pass to write function. See details.

description

Optional description of document.

parent_uuid

UUID of folder in the workspace to create the new document within. If not supplied, the document will be created in the top-level of the workspace.

use_proxy

Logical to indicate whether to use proxy.

Value

API response (invisibly)

Details

This function can be used to write the following data file types: csv, rds, xlsx, parquet. If writing to a new document, use the file_type argument to control which file type to create. If writing a new version of an existing document, the existing file type will be used.

The function works by writing the R object to a temporary file and uploading the file to Objective Connect. The following functions are used to write the data and any additional arguments (...) will be passed to these.

File TypeFunction
csvreadr::write_csv()
rdsreadr::write_rds()
xlsxwritexl::write_xlsx()
parquetnanoparquet::write_parquet()

If there are other data file types you would like to upload using this function, please open an issue on the GitHub repository.

More details on the endpoints used by these functions are available in the API documentation:

  • write_data

  • write_data_version
